text.*:
This is a list of archeological sites where remains or tools of Neanderthals were found.

This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (December 2017) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Some sites where classic Neanderthal fossils were found.
Some sites where Pre-Neanderthal or Protoneanderthal fossils were found.
  • Western Europe north of the Alps and Pyrenees
    • Swanscombe Heritage Park (England) Protoneanderthals
    • Ehringsdorf (Germany) Protoneanderthals
    • Engis (Belgium) Protoneanderthals
    • Scladina (Belgium) Protoneanderthals
    • Veldwezelt-Hezerwater (Belgium) Protoneanderthals
    • Bontnewydd, Llanelwy (Wales) Protoneanderthals
    • Bau de l'Aubesier (France) Protoneanderthals
    • Combe Grenal (France) Protoneanderthals
    • La Chaise (France) Protoneanderthals
    • Naulette (Belgium) Classic Neanderthals
    • Neander Valley (Germany) Classic Neanderthals
    • Northsea shore, (Netherlands) Classic Neanderthals
    • Salzgitter-Lebenstedt (Germany) Classic Neanderthals
    • Spy-sur-l'Orneau (Belgium) Classic Neanderthals
    • La Cotte de St Brelade (Jersey) Classic Neanderthals
    • Grotte du Renne at Arcy-sur-Cure (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • Biache-Saint-Vaast (France) Protoneanderthals
    • Châtelperron (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • La Chapelle-aux-Saints (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • La Ferrassie (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • La Quina (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • Le Moustier (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • Les Rochers-de-Villeneuve (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • Moula-Guercy (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • Le Regourdou (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • Saint-Césaire (France) Classic Neanderthals
    • Creswell Crags (England) Classic Neanderthals
    • Lynford Quarry (England) Classic Neanderthals
  • Iberian Peninsula Classic Neanderthals
    • Furninha cave (Portugal) Classic Neanderthals
    • Abrigo do Lagar Velho (Leiria, Portugal)
    • L'Arbreda (Spain) Classic Neanderthals
    • Atapuerca Mountains (Spain) Protoneanderthals, Classic Neanderthals
    • Axlor (Spain) Classic Neanderthals
    • Banyoles (Catalonia, Spain) Classic Neanderthals
    • Carihuela (Andalucia, Spain) Classic Neanderthals
    • Cova Foradà (Valencian Community, Spain) Classic Neanderthals[1]
    • Cova Negra (Valencian Community, Spain) Classic Neanderthals[2]
    • Cueva de Bolomor (Valencian Community, Spain) Classic Neanderthals[3]
    • Cueva Negra (Region of Murcia, Spain) Protoneanderthals
    • Figueira Brava (Arrabida Mountains, Portugal) Classic Neanderthals
    • Gibraltar Classic Neanderthals
    • Roca dels Bous (archaeological site) Classic Neanderthals
    • Sidrón Cave (Asturias, Spain) Classic Neanderthals
    • Sima de las Palomas (Region of Murcia, Spain) Protoneanderthals
    • Zafarraya (Granada, Spain) Classic Neanderthals
    • Cova del Gegant (Sitges, Spain)[4]
  • Apennine Peninsula
    • Ceprano (Italy) Protoneanderthals
    • Monte Circeo (Italy) Protoneanderthals
    • Saccopastore (Italy) Protoneanderthals
    • Altamura (Italy) Classic Neanderthals
    • Guattari Cave (Italy) Classic Neanderthals
  • Balkan Peninsula
    • Krapina (Croatia) Transition Neanderthals
    • Vindija Cave (Croatia)
  • Central and Eastern Europe
    • Divje Babe (Slovenia) Classic Neanderthals
    • Gánovce (Slovakia) Protoneanderthals
    • Jaskinia Ciemna (Poland)
    • Kiik-Koba (Ukraine) Transition Neanderthals
    • Kůlna (Czech Republic) Transition Neanderthals
    • Mezmaiskaya Cave (Russia) Classic Neanderthals
    • Molodova I (Ukraine Classic Neanderthals[5]
    • Ochoz (Slovakia) Transition Neanderthals
    • Peștera cu Oase (Romania)
    • Peștera Muierilor (Romania)
    • Šaľa (Slovakia) Transition Neanderthals
    • Šipka (Czech Republic) Transition Neanderthals
    • Staroselje (Ukraine) Transition Neanderthals
    • Sukhaya Mechetka (Russia)
  • Southwest Asia
    • Nahal Amud (Israel) Transition Neanderthals
    • Bisitun Cave (Iran) Transition Neanderthals
    • Dederiyeh (Syria) Classic Neanderthals[6][7]
    • Karain (Turkey) Transition Neanderthals
    • Kebara (Israel) Classic Neanderthals
    • Ksar Akil (Lebanon)
    • Shanidar (Iraq) Classic Neanderthals
    • Tabun (Israel) Protoneanderthals
  • Central Asia
    • Teshik-Tash (Uzbekistan) Transition Neanderthals
    • Aman-Kutan (Uzbekistan) Transition Neanderthals
    • Obi-Rakhmat Grotto (Uzbekistan)[8]
  • Siberia
    • Chagyrskaya Cave
    • Okladnikov Cave
This list is incomplete; you can help by expanding it.

References[edit]

PMC 3797767 . PMID 24146934. 
  2. ^ Arsuaga, J.L; Villaverde, V; Quam, R; Martínez, I; Carretero, J.M; Lorenzo, C; Gracia, A (2007). "New Neandertal remains from Cova Negra (Valencia, Spain)". Journal of Human Evolution. 52 (1): 31–58. doi:10.1016/j.jhevol.2006.07.011. PMID 16979220. 
  3. ^ Arsuaga, Juan Luis; Fernández Peris, Josep; Gracia-Téllez, Ana; Quam, Rolf; Carretero, José Miguel; Barciela González, Virginia; Blasco, Ruth; Cuartero, Felipe; Sañudo, Pablo (2012). "Fossil human remains from Bolomor Cave (Valencia, Spain)". Journal of Human Evolution. 62 (5): 629–39. doi:10.1016/j.jhevol.2012.02.002. PMID 22440746. 
  4. ^ Daura, J; Sanz, M; Subirá, M.E; Quam, R; Fullola, J.M; Arsuaga, J.L (2005). "A Neandertal mandible from the Cova del Gegant (Sitges, Barcelona, Spain)". Journal of Human Evolution. 49 (1): 56–70. doi:10.1016/j.jhevol.2005.03.004. PMID 15896823. 
  5. ^ About.com Archaeology, Moldova I (Ukraine)
  6. ^ Akazawa, Takeru; Muhesen, Sultan; Dodo, Yukio; Kondo, Osamu; Mizoguchi, Yuji; Abe, Yoshito; Nishiaki, Yoshihiro; Ohta, Shoji; Oguchi, Takashi; Haydal, Jamal (1995). "Neanderthal infant burial from the Dederiyeh Cave in Syria". Paléorient. 21 (2): 77–86. JSTOR 41492634. 
  7. ^ Schepartz, Lynne (2015). "Akazawa Takeru & Muhesen Sultan (ed.). Neanderthal burials: excavations of the Dederiyeh Cave, Afrin, Syria. xxvii+394 pages, 163 figures, 66 plates, 115 tables. 2003. Auckland: KW; 4-9901694-3-3 hardback". Antiquity. 78 (301): 728–9. doi:10.1017/S0003598X00113407. 
  8. ^ Glantz, Michelle; Viola, Bence; Wrinn, Patrick; Chikisheva, Tatiana; Derevianko, Anatoly; Krivoshapkin, Andrei; Islamov, Uktur; Suleimanov, Rustam; Ritzman, Terrence (2008). "New hominin remains from Uzbekistan". Journal of Human Evolution. 55 (2): 223–37. doi:10.1016/j.jhevol.2007.12.007. PMID 18499228.

range (50–40 ka)
